name: The Normal
description: '''The Normal''' is the [[recording artist]] name used by English music producer [[Daniel Miller (music producer)|Daniel Miller]], a film editor at the time, who is best known as the founder of the [[record label]] [[Mute Records]]. The project encompassed the [[Industrial music|industrial]], [[synthpunk]], and [[minimal synth]], and existed from 1978 to 1980. The project is most known for its debut single, "[[Warm Leatherette]]", which would notably be covered by [[Grace Jones]], [[Duran Duran]], and [[Trent Reznor]] and [[Atticus Ross]] of [[Nine Inch Nails]], and was also featured in the American horror film [[Antebellum (film)|''Antebellum'']] (2020).
